Introduction to Xine Libraries
The Xine Libraries package contains xine libraries. These are useful for interfacing with external plug-ins that allow the flow of information from the source to the audio and video hardware.

sect2.title: Installation of Xine Libraries
sect2.para: Install Xine Libraries by running the following commands:

screen.userinput:
sed -e 's/avcodec_alloc_frame/av_frame_alloc/' \ -e 's/avcodec_free_frame/av_frame_free/' \ -i src/combined/ffmpeg/ff_{audio,video}_decoder.c \ src/dxr3/ffmpeg_encoder.c &&
sed -e 's|wand/magick_wand.h|MagickWand/MagickWand.h|' \ -i src/video_dec/image.c &&
sed -e '/xineplug_vo_out_xcbxv_la_LIBADD/s/$(XCB_LIBS)/$(XCBSHM_LIBS) $(XCB_LIBS)/' \ -i src/video_out/Makefile.in &&
sed -e 's/\(xcb-shape >= 1.0\)/xcb \1/' \ -i m4/video_out.m4 &&
./configure --prefix=/usr \ --disable-vcd \ --with-external-dvdnav \ --docdir=/usr/share/doc/xine-lib-&xine-lib-version; && make

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: sed ...: These commands enable the package to be built with , and .
--disable-vcd: This switch is required to compile Xine Lib without VCDImager installed. Remove this option if you have installed VCDImager.
--with-external-dvdnav: This switch is required, because internal libraries cannot decrypt DVD.
--docdir=/usr/share/doc/xine-lib-&xine-lib-version;: This switch causes the documentation to be installed into a versioned directory instead of the default /usr/share/doc/xine-lib.
